explanation: The report is correct. In the shown function the local variable impl is only read (impl->selectable and impl->fd) and never used to modify the underlying object. Under MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13, the pointer should therefore point to a const-qualified type: e.g. const OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl. Assigning the value returned by the OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro to a const-qualified pointer is valid (converting a pointer-to-non-const to pointer-to-const) and would not require further changes in this function. The only caveat would be if the macro/usage elsewhere requires a modifiable pointer or the object is intentionally mutated; nothing in the shown code indicates that, so the reported violation is valid.
